intro: Angraecoides curvipes, commonly known as the spiral orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Madagascar, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with a distinct, intricate structure that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Angraecoides curvipes is considered a vulnerable species.
